newsitem.title: ITALY: Ambroveneto firms in Milan on CariVerona.
newsitem.headline: Ambroveneto firms in Milan on CariVerona.

text.p: Ialian bank Banco Ambrosiano Veneto (Ambroveneto) rose to a new high for the year on the Milan bourse after opening easier in line with the all-share index.
At 1005 GMT, Ambrovento stock was up 5.34 percent at 5,085 lire in active trading after earlier touching 5,110 lire. The previous high this year was 4,850 lire reached in February.
Dealers said the stock continued to be well bid as its proposed merger with savings bank Cariplo was getting near.
On Thursday Cassa di Resparmio di Verona said it had decided to sell its 12.62 percent stake in Ambroveneto and the buyer will most likely be Cariplo's controlling foundation.
"Cariverona has given the green light to sell the stake, now it's time to discuss the price," one dealer said.
The all-share Mibtel index was off 0.37 percent at 13,357.
